AP - Iraq's top Shiite cleric, Grand Ayatollah Ali al-Sistani, made a dramatic return to Najaf on Thursday and swiftly won agreement from a rebel cleric and the government to end three weeks of fighting between his militia and U.S.-Iraqi forces.

The trials of seven men on Pitcairn Island accused of nearly 100 sexual crimes involving children were delayed until tomorrow.

KIEV -- The bitter political crisis that has gripped Ukraine for more than two weeks eased dramatically yesterday as parliament overwhelmingly approved a compromise package of laws strengthening safeguards against electoral fraud while weakening presidential powers.

KIEV -- The bitter political crisis that has been taking place in Ukraine for more than two weeks has eased considerably yesterday as Parliament overwhelmingly approved a set of compromise laws strengthening guarantees against electoral fraud while weakening presidential powers.

LUXEMBOURG (Reuters) - EU foreign ministers agreed to lift  an arms embargo on Libya on Monday, despite fears for Bulgarian  and Palestinian medical workers sentenced to death there, but  imposed a visa ban on senior officials from Myanmar.

LUXEMBOURG (Reuters) - The EU Foreign Ministers agreed to lift the arms embargo on Libya on Monday, despite the fears of Bulgarian and Palestinian medical workers sentenced to death in that country, but imposed a visa ban on senior Myanmar officials.

Seattle, WA -- The Fresno State defense forced five turnovers, three of them being returned for touchdowns, as the Bulldogs defeated the Washington Huskies by a score of 35-16 in the season opener for both schools at Husky Stadium.

Seattle, WA -- The defense of the state of Fresno forced five rotations, three of them having returned for touchdowns, while the Bulldogs defeated the Washington Huskies with a score of 35-16 in the opening of the season for both schools at the Husky Stadium.

AP - Chinese makers and distributors of pornographic materials sent through the Internet, mobile phones and other communication devices will face penalties as severe as life in prison under new rules that take effect Monday.

AP - Chinese manufacturers and distributors of pornographic material sent by the Internet, mobile phones and other communication devices will be subject to such severe penalties as prison life under new rules that come into force on Monday.

BAGHDAD (Reuters) - Insurgents threatened to kill two  Americans and a Briton unless the United States freed Iraqi  women prisoners, Al Jazeera said Saturday, and a suicide car  bomb killed 23 people outside Iraqi National Guard offices.

BAGHDAD (Reuters) - The insurgents threatened to kill two Americans and one British unless the United States released Iraqi detainees, said Al Jazeera on Saturday, and a car bomb killed 23 people outside the Iraqi National Guard offices.

Eddie Jordan checked out of the hospital yesterday. He ended up there after Washington Wizards trainers examined his swollen left calf on Thanksgiving morning and immediately recommended that the team #39;s head coach see a physician.

At least five people have serious injuries after a high-speed train derailment in south-east Queensland. A Tilt Train commuter service with 157 passengers and seven staff on board came off the tracks north of Bundaberg just after midnight.

Rocco Buttiglione, the Italian nominee to the European Commission whose views on homosexuality resulted in an impasse with MEPs, yesterday decided to step aside.

NEW YORK (Reuters) - The U.S. winter will be longer and  slightly colder than the last, private forecasters say,  spelling a spike in heating oil and natural gas demand even as  high oil prices drive up the cost of heating.

NEW YORK (Reuters) - The U.S. winter will be longer and slightly colder than the last, says private forecasters, the spelling of a peak in demand for oil and natural gas, even though high oil prices increase the cost of heating.

Worldwide semiconductor sales rose a scant 1.5 percent in October, to \$18.8 billion from \$18.5 billion in September, as many chip users pared bloated inventories, the Semiconductor Industry Association said on Friday.
Global semiconductor sales increased 1.5 per cent in October, reaching $18.8 billion, compared to $18.5 billion in September, as the Semiconductor Industry Association said on Friday.

CAMBRIDGE -- Three-year-old Momenta Pharmaceuticals Inc. already has seen its share of milestones. Its scientists cloned the first Heparin sugar-degrading enzyme, a breakthrough in understanding the role of complex sugars as a conduit for viruses and diseases. Its executives recruited medical luminaries like M. Judah Folkman and Eugene Braunwald to the company's scientific advisory board.
